intro: Monelasmum coriaceum, commonly known as the thick-leaved monelasmum, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
